data.title: Tribute, by Maky Madiba Sylla
data.meta_description: “Father / Father, our beloved father / Live a long life / May your name be sanctified / May your strength be strong / Because your existence is useful,” from “Tribute,” by Maky Madiba Sylla
data.text:
Baay

Baay, sunu baay bi

Baay dundal

Na sa tur sell

Na sa nguur dëgër

Ndax sag dundu am na ñjariñ

Baay dundal yàgg fi te wér

Lo nekk baay Yàllaa nay jàmm

Baay, sunu baay bi

Nun ndaw ñi

Naw nanu la

Baay, sunu baay bi

Sag dundu am na njariñ

Li am solo mooy

Nun ndaw ñi gërëm nanu la

Sant nanu la baay

Sa liggéey rafet na

Dina nu topp say tànk baay

Dundal Baay

Father

Father, our beloved father

Live a long life

May your name be sanctified

May your strength be strong

Because your existence is useful

Father, live long and in good health

May peace cover all your undertakings

Father, our father

We the youth

Have great esteem for you

Father, our father

Your existence is useful

The most important thing is

That we the youth thank you very much

And are grateful to you, Father

We magnify your work

We will follow in your footsteps, Father

Long may you live, Father

January 2023

Senegalese writer Boubacar Boris Diop, laureate of the 2022 Neustadt International Prize for Literature, headlines the January 2023 issue of WLT. Also inside, Emily Doyle interviews R. O. Kwon (“On Sex, Soul Loneliness, and Walking toward Terror”), while Shoshana Bellen, Cleyvis Natera, Ana Ojeda, and Danae Sioziou provide additional conversational exchanges. With more than two dozen book reviews, recommended reading lists, and other great content in the latest issue, be sure to take WLT—your passport to great reading—with you into 2023 and beyond.
